name: display_transfer
description: Transfer a token from a user's wallet to another address

token.description: Symbol of the token being transferred. For example, ETH

name: fetch_price
description: Get the price of a token. Note, when the quoteToken isn't explicitly specified assume it to be USD

basetoken.description: Token to get the price of. For example, ETH

quotetoken.description: Token to use as units for price. For example, USD

name: fetch_balance
description: Get the balance of a token in an account or wallet. Don't use this if we don't have the address.

token.description: Token to get the balance of. For example, DAI

address.description: Address of the account or wallet to check the balance of. For example, 0x4eD15A17A9CDF3cc7D6E829428267CaD67d95F8F

name: fetch_my_balance
description: Get the balance of a token in the user's connected wallet

token.description: Token to get the balance of. For example, DAI

name: fetch_transactions
description: Get the transaction details in an account or wallet

address.description: Address of the account or wallet to check the transactions of. For example, 0x3eD15A17A9CDF3cc7D6E829428267CaD67d95F8F

last_n.description: How many latest transactions the user wants to get. For example, 5

name: fetch_gas
description: Get all gas used for transactions in an account or wallet

address.description: Address of the account or wallet to check the gas of. For example, 0x5eF15A17A9CGF3cc7D6E829428267CaD67d95F8F

name: fetch_eth_in
description: Get all ETH inflow into an account or wallet

address.description: Address of the account or wallet to check the inflow ETH. For example, 0x3eD15A17A9CDF3cc7D6E829428267CaD67d95F8F

name: fetch_eth_out
description: Get all ETH outflow from an account or wallet

address.description: Address of the account or wallet to check the outflow ETH. For example, 0x3eD15A17A9CDF3cc7D6E829428267CaD67d95F8F

name: display_uniswap
description:
use the Uniswap decentralized application for trading one token for another. To create a Uniswap transaction, you need either:
1.) A token to sell, a token to buy, the transaction keyword "SELLAMOUNT", and an amount to sell, OR
2.) A token to sell, a token to buy, the transaction keyword "BUYAMOUNT", and an amount to buy.

tokenToSell.description: Token to sell in the swap transaction. For example, BTC

tokenToBuy.description: Token to buy in the swap transaction. For example, MATIC

transactionKeyword.description: Either SELLAMOUNT if amount refers to token to sell or BUYAMOUNT if amount refers to token to buy. For example, SELLAMOUNT

amount.description: Amount of token described by transaction keyword that we are trying to buy or sell. For example, 5

name: fetch_nft_buy_asset
description: Buy an NFT asset of a collection on the OpenSea marketplace, given its network, address, and token ID. Don't use this if we don't have the collection network and address and token ID of the asset we want to purchase.

network.description: Network of the NFT asset. For example, mainnet

address.description: Contract address of the NFT asset. For example, 0x3eD15A17A9CDF3cc7D6E829428267CaD67d95F8F

tokenID.description: Token ID of the asset. For example, ETH

name: fetch_nft_search
description: Search for NFT collections given a query phrase, a description, or a name

query.description: String of keywords to describe the kind of NFT collections to find. For example, 'Penguin NFT'

name: fetch_nft_collection_assets_by_trait
description:
List assets with a particular trait name and value from a specific NFT collection given its network and address. Don't use this if we don't have the collection network and address.
Required parameters:

network.description: Network of the NFT collection. For example, mainnet

address.description: Contract address of the NFT collection. For example, 0x5eF15A17A9CGF3cc7D6E829428267CaD67d95F8F

traitName.description: Name of trait. For example, color

traitValue.description: Value of trait. For example, green

name: fetch_nft_collection_assets_for_sale_by_trait
description: List assets available for purchase with a particular trait name and value from a specific NFT collection given its network and address. Don't use this if we don't have the collection network and address.

network.description: Network of the NFT collection. For example, mainnet

address.description: Contract address of the NFT collection. For example, 0x5eF15A17A9CGF3cc7D6E829428267CaD67d95F8F

traitName.description: Name of trait. For example, color

traitValue.description: Value of trait. For example, green

name: fetch_nft_collection_info
description: Retrieve data and assets of an NFT collection given its network and address.

network.description: network of the NFT collection. For example, mainnet

address.description: Contract address of the NFT collection. For example, 0x4eD15A17A9CDF3cc7D6E829428267CaD67d95F8F

name: fetch_nft_collection_assets_for_sale
description: Retrieve assets available for purchase of an NFT collection given its network and address.

network.description: network of the NFT collection. For example, mainnet

address.description: Contract address of the NFT collection. For example, 0x2eD15A21A9CDF3cc7B7E829428221CaD67d95F8F

name: fetch_nft_collection_traits
description: Retrieve traits of an NFT collection given its network and address.

network.description: Network of the NFT collection. For example, mainnet

address.description: Contract address of the NFT collection. For example, 0x2eD15A21A9CDF3cc7B7E829428221CaD67d95F8F

name: fetch_nft_collection_trait_values
description: Retrieve trait values of a trait of an NFT collection given its network and address.

network.description: network of the NFT collection. For example, mainnet

address.description: Contract address of the NFT collection. For example, 0x2eD15A21A9CDF3cc7B7E829428221CaD67d95F8F

traitName.description: Name of trait to fetch values of. For example, color

name: fetch_nft_asset_traits
description: Retrieve data and traits of an NFT asset in a collection given its network, address, and token ID.

network.description: Network of the NFT asset. For example, mainnet

address.description: Contract address of the NFT asset. For example, 0x6eD15A21A9CDF3cc7B7E829428221CaD67d95F8F

tokenID.description: Token ID of the asset. For example, DAI

name: fetch_yields
description: Get the yields for crypto assets. The user may not specify all parameters so do not guess any parameter.

token.description: Token to get the yield for. Normalize the token name to its popular symbol representation in the ecoystem. Use '*' when parameter not available or the user wants all tokens. For example, 'Who founded Ethereum?'

network.description: Blockchain to get the yield for. Normalize the network name to its popular representation in the ecosystem. Use '*' when parameter not available or the user wants all networks. For example, 'Who founded Ethereum?'

count.description: Number of yield sources. Use '*' when parameter not available. For example, 5

name: ens_from_address
description: Get the ENS domain name (*.eth) for a wallet address.

address.description: Address of the account or wallet. For example, 0x6eD15A21A9CDF3cc7B7E829428221CaD67d95F8F

name: address_from_ens
description: Get the wallet address for an ENS domain name (*.eth).

domain.description: Domain name of the account or wallet. For example, mydomain.eth

name: register_ens_domain
description: Register an ENS domain that ends with *.eth

domain.description: Domain name to register. For example, newdomain.eth

name: set_ens_text
description: Set the text record for an ENS domain that ends with *.eth in a key value pair format.

domain.description: ENS domain name. For example, mydomain.eth

key.description: Key of the text record. For example,

value.description: Value of the text record. For example,

name: set_ens_primary_name
description: Set a primary ENS name for their connected wallet account.

domain.description: Domain name to use as primary ENS name. For example, 0x2eD15A21A9CDF3cc7B7E829428221CaD67d95F8F

name: set_ens_avatar_nft
description: Set an nft as their ENS domain's avatar. Do not guess any parameter, if any parameter is missing, set the default value as 'None'.

domain.description: ENS domain name. For example, thisdomain.eth

nftContractAddress.description: Contract address of the NFT. For example, 0x4eD15A17A9CDF3cc7D6E829428267CaD67d95F8F

nftId.description: Token ID of the NFT. For example, ETH

name: aave_supply
description: Deposit or supply tokens into Aave project

token.description: Token to supply. For example, WETH

name: aave_borrow
description: Borrow tokens from Aave project

token.description: Token to borrow. For example, WETH

name: aave_repay
description: Repay back borrowed tokens from Aave project

token.description: Token to repay. For example, DAI

name: aave_withdraw
description: Withdraw deposited tokens from Aave project

token.description: Token to withdraw. For example, TUSD

name: display_yield_farm
description: Used for the Compound project to allow the user to yield farm by putting tokens or depositing tokens of a certain amount into the Compound project.

project.description: Name of the project to deposit the token in. For example, AAVE

network.description: Network or blockchain of the project. Default to Ethereum if not specified. For example, mainnet

token.description: Token to deposit in the project. For example, ETH

amount.description: Amount of token to deposit in the project. For example, 5

name: fetch_app_info
description: Used when we need to handle common questions and answers about the chat assistant app, what it can do, how to interact with it, at a high-level. Only useful for questions about the chat app experience. It does not know specific information about the web3 ecosystem, of tokens or NFTs or contracts, or access to live data and APIs.

query.description: a standalone query with all relevant contextual details pertaining to the chat web application. For example, 'Describe who are you'

name: fetch_scraped_sites
description: Answer questions using general content scraped from web3 sites. It does not know about this app or about widget magic commands for invoking transactions or fetching data about specific things like NFTs or balances.

query.description: a standalone question representing information to be retrieved from the index. For example, 'Who founded Ethereum?'
